name: CIS Controls v8
description: The CIS Critical Security Controls are a prioritized set of actions that collectively form a defense-in-depth set of best practices that mitigate the most common attacks against systems and networks.

requirements.title: Inventory and Control of Enterprise Assets
requirements.description: Actively manage (inventory, track, and correct) all enterprise assets connected to the infrastructure physically, virtually, remotely, and those within cloud environments.

children.title: Establish and Maintain Detailed Enterprise Asset Inventory
children.description: Establish and maintain an accurate, detailed, and up-to-date inventory of all enterprise assets with the potential to store or process data.

children.title: Address Unauthorized Assets
children.description: Ensure that a process exists to address unauthorized assets on a weekly basis.

children.title: Utilize an Active Discovery Tool
children.description: Utilize an active discovery tool to identify assets connected to the enterprise's network.

children.title: Use Dynamic Host Configuration Protocol (DHCP) Logging
children.description: Use DHCP logging on all DHCP servers or Internet Protocol (IP) address management tools to update the enterprise's asset inventory.

children.title: Use a Passive Asset Discovery Tool
children.description: Use a passive discovery tool to identify assets connected to the enterprise's network.

requirements.title: Inventory and Control of Software Assets
requirements.description: Actively manage (inventory, track, and correct) all software on the network so that only authorized software is installed and can execute.

children.title: Establish and Maintain a Software Inventory
children.description: Establish and maintain a detailed inventory of all licensed software installed on enterprise assets.

children.title: Ensure Authorized Software is Currently Supported
children.description: Ensure that only currently supported software is designated as authorized in the software inventory.

children.title: Address Unauthorized Software
children.description: Ensure that unauthorized software is either removed or the inventory is updated in a timely manner.

children.title: Utilize Automated Software Inventory Tools
children.description: Utilize software inventory tools, when possible, throughout the enterprise to automate the discovery and documentation of installed software.

children.title: Allowlist Authorized Software
children.description: Use technical controls, such as application allowlisting, to ensure that only authorized software can execute or be accessed.

children.title: Allowlist Authorized Libraries
children.description: Use technical controls to ensure that only authorized software libraries can load into a system process.

children.title: Allowlist Authorized Scripts
children.description: Use technical controls, such as digital signatures and version control, to ensure that only authorized scripts can execute.

requirements.title: Data Protection
requirements.description: Develop processes and technical controls to identify, classify, securely handle, retain, and dispose of data.

children.title: Establish and Maintain a Data Management Process
children.description: Establish and maintain a data management process that addresses data sensitivity, data owner, handling of data, data retention limits, and disposal requirements.

children.title: Establish and Maintain a Data Inventory
children.description: Establish and maintain a data inventory, based on the enterprise's data management process.

children.title: Configure Data Access Control Lists
children.description: Configure data access control lists based on a user's need to know.

children.title: Enforce Data Retention
children.description: Retain data according to the enterprise's data management process.

children.title: Securely Dispose of Data
children.description: Securely dispose of data as outlined in the enterprise's data management process.

children.title: Encrypt Data on End-User Devices
children.description: Encrypt data on end-user devices containing sensitive data.

children.title: Establish and Maintain a Data Classification Scheme
children.description: Establish and maintain an overall data classification scheme for the enterprise.

children.title: Document Data Flows
children.description: Document data flows that include service provider data flows and maintain documentation.

children.title: Encrypt Data on Removable Media
children.description: Encrypt data on removable media.

children.title: Encrypt Sensitive Data in Transit
children.description: Encrypt sensitive data in transit.

children.title: Encrypt Sensitive Data at Rest
children.description: Encrypt sensitive data at rest on servers, applications, and databases containing sensitive data.

children.title: Segment Data Processing and Storage Based on Sensitivity
children.description: Segment data processing and storage based on the sensitivity of the data.

children.title: Deploy a Data Loss Prevention Solution
children.description: Implement an automated tool, such as a host-based Data Loss Prevention (DLP) tool to identify all sensitive data.

children.title: Log Sensitive Data Access
children.description: Log sensitive data access, including modification and disposal.

requirements.title: Secure Configuration of Enterprise Assets and Software
requirements.description: Establish and maintain the secure configuration of enterprise assets and software.

children.title: Establish and Maintain a Secure Configuration Process
children.description: Establish and maintain a secure configuration process for enterprise assets and software.

children.title: Establish and Maintain a Secure Configuration Process for Network Infrastructure
children.description: Establish and maintain a secure configuration process for network devices.

children.title: Configure Automatic Session Locking on Enterprise Assets
children.description: Configure automatic session locking on enterprise assets after a defined period of inactivity.

children.title: Implement and Manage a Firewall on Servers
children.description: Implement and manage a firewall on servers, where supported.

children.title: Implement and Manage a Firewall on End-User Devices
children.description: Implement and manage a host-based firewall or port-filtering tool on end-user devices.

children.title: Securely Manage Enterprise Assets and Software
children.description: Securely manage enterprise assets and software through a secure network.

children.title: Manage Default Accounts on Enterprise Assets and Software
children.description: Manage default accounts on enterprise assets and software.

children.title: Uninstall or Disable Unnecessary Services on Enterprise Assets and Software
children.description: Uninstall or disable unnecessary services on enterprise assets and software.

children.title: Configure Trusted DNS Servers on Enterprise Assets
children.description: Configure trusted DNS servers on enterprise assets.

children.title: Enforce Automatic Device Lockout on Portable End-User Devices
children.description: Enforce automatic device lockout following a predetermined threshold of local failed authentication attempts.

children.title: Enforce Remote Wipe Capability on Portable End-User Devices
children.description: Remotely wipe enterprise data from enterprise-owned portable end-user devices when deemed appropriate.

children.title: Separate Enterprise Workspaces on Mobile End-User Devices
children.description: Ensure separate enterprise workspaces are used on mobile end-user devices, where supported.

requirements.title: Account Management
requirements.description: Use processes and tools to assign and manage authorization to credentials for user accounts.

children.title: Establish and Maintain an Inventory of Accounts
children.description: Establish and maintain an inventory of all accounts managed in the enterprise.

children.title: Use Unique Passwords
children.description: Use unique passwords for all enterprise assets.

children.title: Disable Dormant Accounts
children.description: Delete or disable any dormant accounts after a period of 45 days of inactivity.

children.title: Restrict Administrator Privileges to Dedicated Administrator Accounts
children.description: Restrict administrator privileges to dedicated administrator accounts on enterprise assets.

children.title: Establish and Maintain an Inventory of Service Accounts
children.description: Establish and maintain an inventory of service accounts.

children.title: Centralize Account Management
children.description: Centralize account management through a directory or identity service.

requirements.title: Access Control Management
requirements.description: Use processes and tools to create, assign, manage, and revoke access credentials and privileges for user, administrator, and service accounts.

children.title: Establish an Access Granting Process
children.description: Establish and follow a process, preferably automated, for granting access to enterprise assets upon new hire, rights grant, or role change.

children.title: Establish an Access Revoking Process
children.description: Establish and follow a process, preferably automated, for revoking access to enterprise assets.

children.title: Require MFA for Externally-Exposed Applications
children.description: Require all externally-exposed enterprise or third-party applications to enforce MFA.

children.title: Require MFA for Remote Network Access
children.description: Require MFA for remote network access.

children.title: Require MFA for Administrative Access
children.description: Require MFA for all administrative access accounts.

children.title: Establish and Maintain an Inventory of Authentication and Authorization Systems
children.description: Establish and maintain an inventory of the enterprise's authentication and authorization systems.

children.title: Centralize Access Control
children.description: Centralize access control for all enterprise assets through a directory service or SSO provider.

children.title: Define and Maintain Role-Based Access Control
children.description: Define and maintain role-based access control, through determining and documenting the access rights necessary for each role.

requirements.title: Continuous Vulnerability Management
requirements.description: Develop a plan to continuously assess and track vulnerabilities on all enterprise assets.

children.title: Establish and Maintain a Vulnerability Management Process
children.description: Establish and maintain a documented vulnerability management process for enterprise assets.

children.title: Establish and Maintain a Remediation Process
children.description: Establish and maintain a risk-based remediation strategy documented in a remediation process.

children.title: Perform Automated Operating System Patch Management
children.description: Perform operating system updates on enterprise assets through automated patch management on a monthly, or more frequent, basis.

children.title: Perform Automated Application Patch Management
children.description: Perform application updates on enterprise assets through automated patch management on a monthly, or more frequent, basis.

children.title: Perform Automated Vulnerability Scans of Internal Enterprise Assets
children.description: Perform automated vulnerability scans of internal enterprise assets on a quarterly, or more frequent, basis.

children.title: Perform Automated Vulnerability Scans of Externally-Exposed Enterprise Assets
children.description: Perform automated vulnerability scans of externally-exposed enterprise assets using a SCAP-compliant vulnerability scanning tool.

children.title: Remediate Detected Vulnerabilities
children.description: Remediate detected vulnerabilities in software through processes and tooling on a monthly, or more frequent, basis.

requirements.title: Audit Log Management
requirements.description: Collect, alert, review, and retain audit logs of events that could help detect, understand, or recover from an attack.

children.title: Establish and Maintain an Audit Log Management Process
children.description: Establish and maintain an audit log management process that defines the enterprise's logging requirements.

children.title: Collect Audit Logs
children.description: Collect audit logs. Ensure that logging, per the enterprise's audit log management process, has been enabled across enterprise assets.

children.title: Ensure Adequate Audit Log Storage
children.description: Ensure that logging destinations maintain adequate storage to comply with the enterprise's audit log management process.

children.title: Standardize Time Synchronization
children.description: Standardize time synchronization. Configure at least two synchronized time sources across enterprise assets.

children.title: Collect Detailed Audit Logs
children.description: Configure detailed audit logging for enterprise assets containing sensitive data.

children.title: Collect DNS Query Audit Logs
children.description: Collect DNS query audit logs on enterprise assets, where appropriate and supported.

children.title: Collect URL Request Audit Logs
children.description: Collect URL request audit logs on enterprise assets, where appropriate and supported.

children.title: Collect Command-Line Audit Logs
children.description: Collect command-line audit logs. Example implementations include collecting audit logs from PowerShell, BASH, and remote administrative terminals.

children.title: Centralize Audit Logs
children.description: Centralize, to the extent possible, audit log collection and retention across enterprise assets.

children.title: Retain Audit Logs
children.description: Retain audit logs across enterprise assets for a minimum of 90 days.

children.title: Conduct Audit Log Reviews
children.description: Conduct reviews of audit logs to detect anomalies or abnormal events that could indicate a potential threat.

children.title: Collect Service Provider Logs
children.description: Collect service provider logs, where supported. Example implementations include collecting authentication and authorization events.

requirements.title: Email and Web Browser Protections
requirements.description: Improve protections and detections of threats from email and web vectors.

children.title: Ensure Use of Only Fully Supported Browsers and Email Clients
children.description: Ensure only fully supported browsers and email clients are allowed to execute in the enterprise.

children.title: Use DNS Filtering Services
children.description: Use DNS filtering services on all enterprise assets to block access to known malicious domains.

children.title: Maintain and Enforce Network-Based URL Filters
children.description: Enforce and update network-based URL filters to limit an enterprise asset from connecting to potentially malicious or unapproved websites.

children.title: Restrict Unnecessary or Unauthorized Browser and Email Client Extensions
children.description: Restrict, either through uninstalling or disabling, any unauthorized or unnecessary browser or email client plugins, extensions, and add-on applications.

children.title: Implement DMARC
children.description: To lower the chance of spoofed or modified emails from valid domains, implement DMARC policy and verification.

children.title: Block Unnecessary File Types
children.description: Block unnecessary file types attempting to enter the enterprise's email gateway.

children.title: Deploy and Maintain Email Server Anti-Malware Protections
children.description: Deploy and maintain email server anti-malware protections, such as attachment scanning and/or sandboxing.

requirements.title: Malware Defenses
requirements.description: Prevent or control the installation, spread, and execution of malicious applications, code, or scripts on enterprise assets.

children.title: Deploy and Maintain Anti-Malware Software
children.description: Deploy and maintain anti-malware software on all enterprise assets.

children.title: Configure Automatic Anti-Malware Signature Updates
children.description: Configure automatic updates for anti-malware signature files on all enterprise assets.

children.title: Disable Autorun and Autoplay for Removable Media
children.description: Disable autorun and autoplay auto-execute functionality for removable media.

children.title: Configure Automatic Anti-Malware Scanning of Removable Media
children.description: Configure anti-malware software to automatically scan removable media.

children.title: Enable Anti-Exploitation Features
children.description: Enable anti-exploitation features on enterprise assets and software, where possible.

children.title: Centrally Manage Anti-Malware Software
children.description: Centrally manage anti-malware software.

children.title: Use Behavior-Based Anti-Malware Software
children.description: Use behavior-based anti-malware software.

requirements.title: Data Recovery
requirements.description: Establish and maintain data recovery practices sufficient to restore in-scope enterprise assets to a pre-incident and trusted state.

children.title: Establish and Maintain a Data Recovery Process
children.description: Establish and maintain a data recovery process. In the process, address the scope of data recovery activities, recovery prioritization, and the security of backup data.

children.title: Perform Automated Backups
children.description: Perform automated backups of in-scope enterprise assets.

children.title: Protect Recovery Data
children.description: Protect recovery data with equivalent controls to the original data.

children.title: Establish and Maintain an Isolated Instance of Recovery Data
children.description: Establish and maintain an isolated instance of recovery data using offline, cloud, or off-site systems or services.

children.title: Test Data Recovery
children.description: Test backup recovery quarterly, or more frequently, for a sampling of in-scope enterprise assets.

requirements.title: Network Infrastructure Management
requirements.description: Establish and maintain the secure configuration of network devices.

children.title: Ensure Network Infrastructure is Up-to-Date
children.description: Ensure network infrastructure is kept up-to-date.

children.title: Establish and Maintain a Secure Network Architecture
children.description: Establish and maintain a secure network architecture.

children.title: Securely Manage Network Infrastructure
children.description: Securely manage network infrastructure.

children.title: Establish and Maintain Architecture Diagram(s)
children.description: Establish and maintain architecture diagram(s) and/or other network system documentation.

children.title: Centralize Network Authentication, Authorization, and Auditing (AAA)
children.description: Centralize network AAA.

children.title: Use of Secure Network Management and Communication Protocols
children.description: Use secure network management and communication protocols.

children.title: Ensure Remote Devices Utilize a VPN and are Connecting to an Enterprise's AAA Infrastructure
children.description: Require users to authenticate to enterprise-managed VPN and authentication infrastructure prior to accessing enterprise resources on end-user devices.

children.title: Establish and Maintain Dedicated Computing Resources for All Administrative Work
children.description: Establish and maintain dedicated computing resources, either physically or logically separated, for all administrative tasks or tasks requiring administrative access.

requirements.title: Network Monitoring and Defense
requirements.description: Operate processes and tooling to establish and maintain comprehensive network monitoring and defense against security threats.

children.title: Centralize Security Event Alerting
children.description: Centralize security event alerting across enterprise assets for log correlation and analysis.

children.title: Deploy a Host-Based Intrusion Detection Solution
children.description: Deploy a host-based intrusion detection solution on enterprise assets, where appropriate and/or supported.

children.title: Deploy a Network Intrusion Detection Solution
children.description: Deploy a network intrusion detection solution on enterprise assets, where appropriate.

children.title: Perform Traffic Filtering Between Network Segments
children.description: Perform traffic filtering between network segments, where appropriate.

children.title: Manage Access Control for Remote Assets
children.description: Manage access control for assets remotely connecting to enterprise resources based upon their security posture.

children.title: Collect Network Traffic Flow Logs
children.description: Collect network traffic flow logs and/or network traffic to review and alert upon from network devices.

children.title: Deploy a Host-Based Intrusion Prevention Solution
children.description: Deploy a host-based intrusion prevention solution on enterprise assets, where appropriate and/or supported.

children.title: Deploy a Network Intrusion Prevention Solution
children.description: Deploy a network intrusion prevention solution, where appropriate.

children.title: Deploy Port-Level Access Control
children.description: Deploy port-level access control. Port-level access control utilizes 802.1x, or similar network access control protocols and functions.

children.title: Perform Application Layer Filtering
children.description: Perform application layer filtering. Example implementations include a filtering proxy, application layer firewall, or gateway.

children.title: Tune Security Event Alerting Thresholds
children.description: Tune security event alerting thresholds monthly, or more frequently.

requirements.title: Security Awareness and Skills Training
requirements.description: Establish and maintain a security awareness program to influence behavior among the workforce to be security conscious.

children.title: Establish and Maintain a Security Awareness Program
children.description: Establish and maintain a security awareness program.

children.title: Train Workforce Members to Recognize Social Engineering Attacks
children.description: Train workforce members to recognize social engineering attacks, such as phishing, pre-texting, and tailgating.

children.title: Train Workforce Members on Authentication Best Practices
children.description: Train workforce members on authentication best practices.

children.title: Train Workforce on Data Handling Best Practices
children.description: Train workforce members on how to identify and properly store, transfer, archive, and destroy sensitive data.

children.title: Train Workforce Members on Causes of Unintentional Data Exposure
children.description: Train workforce members to be aware of causes for unintentional data exposure.

children.title: Train Workforce Members on Recognizing and Reporting Security Incidents
children.description: Train workforce members to be able to recognize a potential incident and be able to report such an incident.

children.title: Train Workforce on How to Identify and Report if Their Enterprise Assets are Missing Security Updates
children.description: Train workforce to understand how to verify and report out-of-date software patches or any failures in automated processes and tools.

children.title: Train Workforce on the Dangers of Connecting to and Transmitting Enterprise Data Over Insecure Networks
children.description: Train workforce members on the dangers of connecting to, and transmitting data over, insecure networks for enterprise activities.

children.title: Conduct Role-Specific Security Awareness and Skills Training
children.description: Conduct role-specific security awareness and skills training.

requirements.title: Service Provider Management
requirements.description: Develop a process to evaluate service providers who hold sensitive data, or are responsible for an enterprise's critical IT platforms or processes.

children.title: Establish and Maintain an Inventory of Service Providers
children.description: Establish and maintain an inventory of service providers.

children.title: Establish and Maintain a Service Provider Management Policy
children.description: Establish and maintain a service provider management policy.

children.title: Classify Service Providers
children.description: Classify service providers. Classification consideration may include one or more characteristics.

children.title: Ensure Service Provider Contracts Include Security Requirements
children.description: Ensure service provider contracts include security requirements.

children.title: Assess Service Providers
children.description: Assess service providers consistent with the enterprise's service provider management policy.

children.title: Monitor Service Providers
children.description: Monitor service providers consistent with the enterprise's service provider management policy.

children.title: Securely Decommission Service Providers
children.description: Securely decommission service providers.

requirements.title: Application Software Security
requirements.description: Manage the security life cycle of in-house developed, hosted, or acquired software.

children.title: Establish and Maintain a Secure Application Development Process
children.description: Establish and maintain a secure application development process.

children.title: Establish and Maintain a Process to Accept and Address Software Vulnerabilities
children.description: Establish and maintain a process to accept and address reports of software vulnerabilities.

children.title: Perform Root Cause Analysis on Security Vulnerabilities
children.description: Perform root cause analysis on security vulnerabilities.

children.title: Establish and Manage an Inventory of Third-Party Software Components
children.description: Establish and manage an updated inventory of third-party components used in development.

children.title: Use Up-to-Date and Trusted Third-Party Software Components
children.description: Use up-to-date and trusted third-party software components.

children.title: Establish and Maintain a Severity Rating System and Process for Application Vulnerabilities
children.description: Establish and maintain a severity rating system and process for application vulnerabilities.

children.title: Use Standard Hardening Configuration Templates for Application Infrastructure
children.description: Use standard, industry-recommended hardening configuration templates for application infrastructure components.

children.title: Separate Production and Non-Production Systems
children.description: Maintain separate environments for production and non-production systems.

children.title: Train Developers in Application Security Concepts and Secure Coding
children.description: Ensure that all software development personnel receive training in writing secure code for their specific development environment and responsibilities.

children.title: Apply Secure Design Principles in Application Architectures
children.description: Apply secure design principles in application architectures.

children.title: Leverage Vetted Modules or Services for Application Security Components
children.description: Leverage vetted modules or services for application security components.

children.title: Implement Code-Level Security Checks
children.description: Apply static and dynamic analysis tools within the application life cycle to verify that secure coding practices are being followed.

children.title: Conduct Application Penetration Testing
children.description: Conduct application penetration testing.

children.title: Conduct Threat Modeling
children.description: Conduct threat modeling.

requirements.title: Incident Response Management
requirements.description: Establish a program to develop and maintain an incident response capability.

children.title: Designate Personnel to Manage Incident Handling
children.description: Designate one key person, and at least one backup, who will manage the enterprise's incident handling process.

children.title: Establish and Maintain Contact Information for Reporting Security Incidents
children.description: Establish and maintain contact information for parties that need to be informed of security incidents.

children.title: Establish and Maintain an Enterprise Process for Reporting Incidents
children.description: Establish and maintain an enterprise process for the workforce to report security incidents.

children.title: Establish and Maintain an Incident Response Process
children.description: Establish and maintain an incident response process that addresses roles and responsibilities, compliance requirements, and a communication plan.

children.title: Assign Key Roles and Responsibilities
children.description: Assign key roles and responsibilities for incident response.

children.title: Define Mechanisms for Communicating During Incident Response
children.description: Determine which primary and secondary mechanisms will be used to communicate and report during a security incident.

children.title: Conduct Routine Incident Response Exercises
children.description: Plan and conduct routine incident response exercises and scenarios for key personnel involved in the incident response process.

children.title: Conduct Post-Incident Reviews
children.description: Conduct post-incident reviews.

children.title: Establish and Maintain Security Incident Thresholds
children.description: Establish and maintain security incident thresholds, including, at a minimum, differentiating between an incident and an event.

requirements.title: Penetration Testing
requirements.description: Test the effectiveness and resiliency of enterprise assets through identifying and exploiting weaknesses in controls and simulating the objectives and actions of an attacker.

children.title: Establish and Maintain a Penetration Testing Program
children.description: Establish and maintain a penetration testing program appropriate to the size, complexity, and maturity of the enterprise.

children.title: Perform Periodic External Penetration Tests
children.description: Perform periodic external penetration tests based on program requirements, no less than annually.

children.title: Remediate Penetration Test Findings
children.description: Remediate penetration test findings based on the enterprise's policy for remediation scope and prioritization.

children.title: Validate Security Measures
children.description: Validate security measures after each penetration test.

children.title: Perform Periodic Internal Penetration Tests
children.description: Perform periodic internal penetration tests based on program requirements, no less than annually.
